title: Part (a)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response must show appropriate work in order to receive the point.

title: Part (b)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response must both state that the production function exhibits diminishing returns and explain why in order to receive the point. In addition to the explanation given, it is also acceptable for the student to simply explain that starting with the 4th worker, each additional worker adds less to total output thus exhibiting diminishing returns to labor.
descriptions: The response does not state that the production function exhibits diminishing returns or does not explain that because of the fixed input in the short run, initially, as more and more workers are added (from zero to three), total product increases at an increasing rate. It then continues to increase at a decreasing rate (from four to six), and further additions of labor eventually result in a decline in total product. Thus the production function exhibits diminishing returns to labor.

The response correctly states that the production function exhibits diminishing returns and goes on to explain that because of the fixed input in the short run, initially, as more and more workers are added (from zero to three), total product increases at an increasing rate. It then continues to increase at a decreasing rate (from four to six), and further additions of labor eventually result in a decline in total product. Thus the production function exhibits diminishing returns to labor.

title: Part (c)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe the relationship between marginal product and marginal cost. That is, when marginal product is falling, marginal cost must be rising. OR the response does not state that the marginal cost is a mirror image of the marginal product; it rises as marginal product falls due to diminishing returns.

The response correctly describes the relationship between marginal product and marginal cost—when marginal product is falling, the marginal cost must be rising. OR the response states that the marginal cost is a mirror image of the marginal product; it rises as marginal product falls due to diminishing returns.

title: Part (d)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The response accurately includes both of the criteria below.
